definition: abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
lit. diverse opinions confused and divided (idiom); opinions differ/controversial matters

sentences.english: Then David said to the whole assembly, 'Praise the Lord your God.
sentences.chinese: 大卫对全会众说，你们应当称颂耶和华你们的神。

sentences.english: And David said to all the congregation, Now bless the LORD your God.
sentences.chinese: 大卫对全会众说，你们应当称颂耶和华你们的神。

sentences.english: The origin of distillate liquor in ancient China is still an unsettled enigma for experts.
sentences.chinese: 我国古代蒸馏酒的起源，众说纷云，莫衷一是。

definition: unable to reach a decision (idiom); cannot agree on the right choice/no unanimous decision/still a matter of discussion
The benevolent sees benevolence, the wise sees wisdom./Different views are admissible. (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 zhe3 jian4 ren2 , zhi4 zhe3 jian4 zhi4

definition: each sticks to his own opinion (idiom); chacun son gout
(of a body of people) to offer all kinds of different opinions (idiom)/to argue endlessly
what is true and what is fake
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
